intro: Polytoca massiei, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte or lithophyte, often found on trees or rocks in its natural habitat. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive. Its ornamental value makes it a popular houseplant worldwide.
